conclusion: Understanding isothermal processes where temperature remains constant and pV is constant.
State A and state D are connected by a vertical line in the P-V diagram indicating constant volume.
Volume does not change from D to A, but pressure increases.
Rate distribution of gas molecules depends on temperature.
If temperature remains the same, the rate distribution curve does not change.
Temperature at state A is the same as at state B due to isothermal process A→B.
Temperature at state D is the same as at state C due to isothermal process C→D.
Temperature at state A must be the same as at state D to ensure the cycle is closed.
Rate distribution curve does not change from state D to state A.
